result.execSummary:
The defendant Stasha M. WALTERS was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

No assaultive contact with Kelvin Jones.

timeConds.notes:
Ten (10) days, under the Huber Law;
Ten (10) days, stayed to be imposed upon the agent's discretion.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stasha M. WALTERS

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change and Discharge from DOC indicating that defendant was terminated from probation effective 08-07-2016

The defendant states she has a public defender but doesnt know her name.  The case shows Attorney Ann Larson who is still in B-15 on another matter.
The defendant is told to wait until her attorney gets here and the case will be recalled.
Minutes.

Based on the stipulation of the parties, the Court hereby orders that the no-contact order between the Defendant and Kelvin Jones is modified to a no-assaultive contact provision, that Defendant is allowed contact at 1706 Cedar Grove Drive #3A in Manitowoc, Wisconsin, and that the provision requiring child exchanges to be done through a 3rd party is removed.

Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 04-24-15 at 2:30 p.m.   Plea date is set for 07-20-15 at 11:00 a.m.    
Minutes.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

ADDRESS INFO for Stasha M. WALTERS
Current: 604A Buffalo Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States  (Effective: 03-18-2015)
Prior: 2110 School Street, Two Rivers, WI 54241

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of substantial battery.  The matter is  continued for initial appearance on 03-30-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that she have no contact with Kelvin Jones or his residence at 1706 Cedar Grove Drive #3A, Manitowoc, WI 54220.  Child exchanges will need to be done through a 3rd party.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
